news.title: Milky Way may bear 100 million life-giving planets
news.summary: There are some 100 million other places in the Milky Way galaxy that could support complex life, report a group of university astronomers. They have developed a new computation method to examine data from planets orbiting other stars in the universe.

news.title: 100 millions de planètes seraient habitables dans notre galaxie
news.summary: C'est le résultat d'une étude statistique réalisée par une équipe internationale de chercheurs à partir d'un "indice de complexité biologique" des exoplanètes.

news.title: Galaxy possibly teeming with 100 million life-sustaining planets
news.summary: Forget close encounters of a third kind. Imagine galactic encounters with millions of planets in the Milky Way galaxy, each of them overflowing with complex life forms. A new study says it’s a possibility.

news.title: Milky Way Galaxy May Have 100 Million Planets that Could Support Life
news.summary: Could other planets support life? It's likely, and there may be more in our very own galaxy than previously thought. Astronomers have found that there are about 100 million other places in the Milky Way galaxy that could support complex life.

news.title: Milky Way may bear 100 million life-giving planets
news.summary: There are some 100 million other places in the Milky Way galaxy that could support complex life, according to new research by astronomers. They have developed a new computation method to examine data from planets orbiting other stars in the universe.

news.title: Scientists: 100 million worlds may have complex alien life in our galaxy
news.summary: A group of international astronomers and astrobiologists have published new research that assesses the possibility of complex life on other worlds. Their calculation in the Milky Way alone is staggering: 100 million worlds in our home galaxy may harbor com

news.title: Milky Way may Harbor 100 Million Other Life-Sustaining Worlds
news.summary: There are some 100 million other places in the Milky Way galaxy that could support complex life, report a group of astronomers in the journal Challenges.

news.title: Milky Way May Have More Than A 100 Million Life-Supporting Planets, Study
news.summary: Using a new computation method, Cornell University researchers found that the Milky Way may be hosting more than a 100 million life-supporting planets.

news.title: How Habitable Is That Exoplanet? [Flowchart]

news.title: 100 millions de planètes de la Galaxie compatibles avec une vie complexe
news.summary: Dans une récente étude conduite par le professeur émérite Louis Irwin, entre 1 et 2 % des exoplanètes de la Galaxie pourraient abriter une vie plus complexe que les bactéries. En tenant compte de paramètres connus ou supposés sur un échantillon de planètes

news.title: Milky Way Could Have 100 Million Planets Hospitable for Complex Life
news.summary: Based on what we know now about the abundance of planets across the galaxy, astronomers try to calculate just how many worlds out there could host life thats more complicated than a microbe.
